website_summaries.verdict: A quality choice for the true survivalist. From preparation and prevention to preserving a high-quality of life if hit with the worst, this book has it all.
pros: Cobb touches on topics that most survival guides don't, like education and entertainment
His focus isn't just on surviving, but thriving in the face of extreme scenarios
The book prepares you should you lose power for weeks or months
Food growth and storage, defending your home, and how to start a new society are just a few of the topics covered
cons: Sometimes recommends other books instead of expanding on topic

customer_reviews.title: Book is just a money grab.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of time. This book is literally just a list of things anyone with half a brain would have for a survival situation. The books suggestion for security is to buy a gun, nothing about how to use or maintain it one, the suggestion for collecting water is to store ahead of time or have chemicals to filter it. This book knowledge that anyone who has thought about prepping already possesses, it's nothing but an attempt to get your money, avoid this garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Not a useful book. Author tells you why you should be ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a useful book. Author tells you why you should be prepared but there are not really any how to's. This is not a guide for survival. Not one picture or diagram. Better off with military survival guide
customer_reviews.author: larry hingtgen

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't really address long term scenarios
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly well written book with a lot of solid common sense advice for people new to prepping. However, I bought it expecting to find detailed information to address the real challenges of living in a long term grid down situation. It does not deliver. For example, the advice on keeping warm in the winter is basically "wear warm clothes and keep a fire going". So, not worth the $10 in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very weak. Not a good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Nothing new here. He points out why you should be prepared but doesn't tell you how to survive should the day come.
customer_reviews.author: steved

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: Very little useful information in this book. Not well researched. It was like he was writing a fiction story that was going on in his head rather than something to use as a guide. If you grew up on a farm or live in rural America you already know more than is written in this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Embarrassing
customer_reviews.text: This book has a really attractive cover however, it’s best function in case of an emergency would be using its pages to assist in fire making. Any person with common sense could write this book. Honestly, you would be better off watching World War Z several times as a source to reference for survival. I wasn’t entertained in the least. I bought it used but it’s still a waste of 9 bucks for “Fire Paper”.. Don’t buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mchisem

customer_reviews.title: Not a guide at all
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a LOT more. This is called long term survival guide but gives no guidance, just tells you things to consider. Example (rain catchment) tells you to collect but gives no plans/examples/pitfalls in building one. In winter it says “wear warm clothes) REALLY?? Wow so insightful. Sorry was very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: D. Waters

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected. It is NOT a guide on how to do it.
customer_reviews.text: NOT WHAT I EXPECTED. The best I can say about this book is that the author tells you what you may need to know, no guidance on how. He explains what could go wrong and what your needs might be. There little or no information on how to do the tasks. Only that you should have these skill but little OR NO GUIDANCE on how. And, there is a BUGGING OUT list. To carry all the items on his list you'll need a large delivery truck. I'm no expert (the reason I was looking for a survival guide) but, I feel my money could have been much better spent elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Vic S.

customer_reviews.title: More for those who hope for society’s downfall
customer_reviews.text: If you are a wannabe member of a militia who fetishizes a Thunderdome meets Postman world and who also isn’t opposed to being part of a sadistic ruling class with a ‘capital punishment is a valid consideration’ value system then this book is for you. This is provided that you want a stream of consciousness narrative that sticks to generalities and could very well be an appendix to the Zombie Survival Guide. I was hoping for specific advice of how to prep for a long period of emergency from a rational perspective, not a blueprint for right wing dreams of apocalypse.
customer_reviews.author: Rationalitarian

customer_reviews.title: BASIC Information, that’s it!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never considered myself a prepper however after reading this book and finding out that it is so basic I guess I am a prepper but did not realize it because the information is just such basic information. This book is basic information. If you know anything about being prepared for life this book is not for you. It had good historical information about the events that happened throughout history around the world but other than that not much more useful information. If you know how to pack for a vacation basically you have the information in this book. I recommend one of the SAS survival books, they have much more useful information.
customer_reviews.author: David L

customer_reviews.title: This is basically a list of other things to buy-don't do it.
customer_reviews.text: This is just a list of things you should research on your own. Not even descriptions. It is judgemental and condescending in its writing. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: SB12

customer_reviews.title: Vague and lacks details
customer_reviews.text: In his book he wrote "if building a bug out bag is Prepping 101 consider this Prepping 401." I would say this book is maybe Prepping 201 at best. Each topic might have half to 2 pages of info and that info does not go into detail of how to do it step by step. It gives you a push into thinking about that topic. I was looking for more of a step by step guide like google but in paper form to reference when the internet/grid is gone. Pretty much any survival forum website would be a better use of your time reading than this book.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ONE OF THE BEST WAYS TO MARVEL EVER
customer_reviews.text: Unless you've gone thru the process of writing your own book, I doubt any book will get it's proper appreciation. I liked it so much, this copy was for a friend. Altho very detailed and covers quite a bit of subject matter, it doesn't have everything. Even the entire set of encyclopedia Britannica is missing a few bits. That's why we all need to "do a little research" but kudos's to those who actually looked up from their IPhone 5,6,7 long enough to crack open one of these antique thingy's full of words...aren't they just the most amazing things?
customer_reviews.author: Koaheart

customer_reviews.title: Very enjoyable read...
customer_reviews.text: Very good pointers, and very nice situational awareness tips. I haven't sat down and read a book in 30 years...but with all that's going on...I figured what the heck...Great stuff! I love the check list at the end as it gives you a full re-cap of all important supplies ya may need to pick up, if ya don't already own them. I love that it wasn't a million pages long...This is a good book for people who want to learn some great tips without having to invest night after night of dedication to finish a lengthy book...Thanks for all of your ideas and input
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Smith

customer_reviews.title: " I came to it as a complete novice and I feel like it did a really great job
customer_reviews.text: This book is written with the long-term view in mind, as opposed to "here's how to build your bug-out bag." I came to it as a complete novice and I feel like it did a really great job. The introduction advised against being the initial book for a new prepper, but I don't think it's above a beginner's level or too advanced. Being geared towards the long-term, it helps actually to have the long view in mind as you start. You know what you're building towards. The writing style is very simple and easy to follow. He gives clear explanations on why one technique might be preferred to another, and the different scenarios where something would be helpful. Definitely recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: it has everything to consider and gives great references for other books to incorporate in your indepth ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a mid-level book. More detail than for someone who is faintly interested in survival. And not as thorough as a book you'd want as your "survival bible" by your side in case of a major disaster. But, it has everything to consider and gives great references for other books to incorporate in your indepth research. I think this is a great starting point for sure and has been super helpful in reminding us how to sure up our plans, just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing to learn here..
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. I thought there would be instructions and some how-to bits of information, but all this has is opinions of the author on what things are essential for surviving, and limited descriptions at that. I do no recommend this for anyone trying to learn skills.
customer_reviews.author: SVT3528

customer_reviews.title: Esential read for all Preppers!
customer_reviews.text: This book is one of the best I have read. Jim Cobb speaks to you through this book as if he was sitting at the table with you. Very informative and gave me some insight on things I was either lagging in and a few ideas I had not thought of. I really liked the 3rd person scenarios. That stuff was spooky but it made me think in more detail. This is a must have for any Prepper! As we all know, there are just some things we always overlook and can never prepare for everything. Excellent read!
customer_reviews.author: Tony

customer_reviews.title: Prepare for the end of the world  . . . with this book
customer_reviews.text: What do you do when you love the show "Preppers" and want to prepare yourself? Obviously you buy a book to educate you on everything from living off the grid to shooting intruders addressing the legal repercussions thereafter. Doesn't dive too heavily into each topic but enough to give a brief intro on each topic (how do you get rid of your waste? What about insulin storage? etc. ) Great bathroom reader.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Save your money for something else.
customer_reviews.text: Any book that spends the first pages praising itself can't hardly be considered good, helpful or even new. Some old time stories about how prepping was normal everyday life way back when to make it sound more appealing to the reader but honestly, it's not worth the money. If you have basic knowledge of how to start a fire with a match, purify water with a water filter you can buy online, and know how to build a shelter with a tarp you're already smarter than this book and should save your money.
customer_reviews.author: John Doe

customer_reviews.title: Not a survival guide!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Don’t waste your money. It’s literally a list of what this guy owns and his opinion on a few things. There is zero survival stuff in here. Pass this up. Hopefully I can get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Maciag

customer_reviews.title: Information is found in any survival book or website. ...
customer_reviews.text: Information is found in any survival book or website. Pictures when describing how-to directions are always helpful and aid in learning. There are zero pictures in this book so I felt the cover was kind of deceptive. Not expensive enough to warrant return (probably what they count on) so I'll learn what I can and keep it around for grandkids to read. Hope Amazon decides to give more info on books or I won't be buying anymore from them.
customer_reviews.author: dws

customer_reviews.title: Worst possible book for preppers
customer_reviews.text: Great book if you are not a prepper and have never thought about living off grid. Horrible if you are actually planning to prep. No pictures, plans, diagrams or scenarios.
customer_reviews.author: Julian

customer_reviews.title: This is really nice and complete! Good present!
customer_reviews.text: This is a realistic book with useful information and some knowledge that I haven't found on any of the usual Tv shows. I'm happily surprised...! :) If you are considering this as a present for somebody who likes surviving stuff... I think they will like it because of the additional information you don't usualy find anywhere else. It's pretty cool!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: It is a good book for a young person who has never given ...
customer_reviews.text: Not much new. I saw the picture of the windmill and thought it would tell how to build one, but no such luck. It is a good book for a young person who has never given a thought to how things used to be, but I am an old person who thinks about such things all the time. I remember a lot of old things from the forties, but a refresher on how to do those things is hard to find.
customer_reviews.author: Buff EWO

customer_reviews.title: not worth it
customer_reviews.text: pretty basic, the book only goes over generalities, but does not explain or outline procedures
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This book is a joke
customer_reviews.text: And if It isn't then it sure as h*** seems like it is
customer_reviews.author: Joey Patton

customer_reviews.title: All-inclusive survival summary! Must read!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent guide. It covers about every area in enough detail to be helpful but not so much to get bogged down, and the author provides common sense tips throughout. Also, where he doesn’t dig in to an area that could use more expansion, he recommends other reference books. It is also an entertaining read despite the somber topic. Everyone should read this book and keep it handy!
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: More a non-fiction novel than a reference guide
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed by this book. I was expecting a reference guide of sorts, but it reads like a novel. There is literally not a single diagram or image, like you would expect from a "how-to guide" There are many different topics covered, and would be fine for an intro overview. But nothing extremely practical, or worth keeping or re-reading.
customer_reviews.author: marge

customer_reviews.title: Great knowledge that everyone should know!
customer_reviews.text: Well written book loaded with ideas. This is another book that I honestly hope I will never have to depend on, but if I do - this is a great source of knowledge. How many of us would actually know how to survive on our own if we had to? I want to read and have access to printed copies of as much information as possible to provide for and protect my family if the need should arise.
customer_reviews.author: WES STORM

customer_reviews.title: He covers the basic needs like water, food and the need for community
customer_reviews.text: This is the book I meant to review...not Urban Emergency Survival Plan. Prepper's Long-Term Survival Guide is a must if you want to make it through a real melt-down. It's basic, logical and simple. He covers the basic needs like water, food and the need for community. And I see some great attitude in this. Jim Cobb starts each chapter with a running story about a community that has survived SHTF. The people have rebuilt their lives to survive successfully; it's realistic, not romantic or alarmist. It offers help, but not without a lot of hard work.
customer_reviews.author: Lydia Jasper

customer_reviews.title: then I found this to be a pretty good guide
customer_reviews.text: If you want info on prepping for LONG term survival (like the lights go out and don't come back on), then I found this to be a pretty good guide. It brought up quite a few things I had never even thought of, and it does give examples of products he himself likes. He also presents information in a pretty casual way, so it doesn't read extremely dull. If you want something like "how to survive an natural disaster till help arrives" there are probably better books for you.
customer_reviews.author: Lunarhuntress

customer_reviews.title: Everyone should have this very handy book when disaster hits
customer_reviews.text: Great to have when disaster hits , living in hurricane country can be challenging when the lights go out, water contaminated, no gas stations open , no ATM or stores open for weeks until power is restored
customer_reviews.author: sharyn

customer_reviews.title: A grt teaching tool
customer_reviews.text: I love a good read, and know that at some point we will face this one day, as we have become a hugely selfish nation...and most have lost the ability to survive outside of the computer age, utube, facebook etc
customer_reviews.author: shelly

customer_reviews.title: Surviving a Disaster
customer_reviews.text: After reading Ted Coppels book, Lights Out and the danger to our country if we are without electricity, I wanted to find a book to provide some information on how to survive for a long time with out our usual resources. I found Jim Cobbs book very informative. I plan to give this to some family members. More important then the usual holiday gifts.
customer_reviews.author: Rita R. Montes-martin

customer_reviews.title: Worth  trying
customer_reviews.text: This book was just a retelling of some of the things I'm already aware of so it wasn't very interesting to me. If you're just getting into the prepper stuff you should find it interesting and get some ideas from it.
customer_reviews.author: Royce Watson

customer_reviews.title: While it was easy to read it really did not contain any new ...
customer_reviews.text: While it was easy to read it really did not contain any new or already well-known information. It would probably be a worthwhile read if you were just getting interested in the topic but it has limited value other than an "introduction' capacity. In short it was OK but nothing special
customer_reviews.author: Gary Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome book and is great for anyone who wants to know what to do if things get bad!
customer_reviews.author: Ann M. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Great Survival Book
customer_reviews.text: Great read! Simple instructions. Concise yet valuable information in each chapter. Provides simple steps that everyone can take to prepare in the event of a catastrophic event. A fast read! Should be standard reference book in everyone's home.
customer_reviews.author: D. King

customer_reviews.title: Just starting preppers will really love the advice for long term and skip the hipe ...
customer_reviews.text: He sure is the right person to write this book. Many new suggestions for finding info. was very helpful. Just starting preppers will really love the advice for long term and skip the hipe for cheap items.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki S.

customer_reviews.title: Great beginners!
customer_reviews.text: Great book for beginner prep pets. Gave me some great insight to be prepared for disaster. Bought it after reading book from library.
customer_reviews.author: AdventureGirl

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Thorough Guide
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself somewhat knowledgeable in this area and I learned a ton of new information and ideas. Great for true beginners as well. As I write this (end of April 2020) the possibility of economic collapse is more real than I ever have experienced in my life. However, it’s not too late read this book and get to work!
customer_reviews.author: Barefoot Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: I really got into this book. It was designed mainly for long-term survival, but you could also use it short term. Yes, a lot of what was in it was common sense, but sometimes we need reminders. My husband and I made a list of things we hadn't thought of. I especially enjoyed reading the short apocalypse 'diary' blips at the beginning of each chapter. Those were very entertaining. Over all a really good book and well worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA

customer_reviews.title: The First Book You Should Buy
customer_reviews.text: This book had exactly the information I wanted. It is written in a very readable style with small snippets of fiction describing the world after the collapse. I would really recommend this book first to get all the basic you need for survival before you buy books dealing with specific problems. I have already recommended it to several of my friends. I am also considering purchasing more books by this author
customer_reviews.author: Debra Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Good book to look into later on in your prepping book collection.
customer_reviews.text: This book is interesting. No pictures in this book and the author covers the same basic areas as others who write about this topic. However, the author stresses certain subjects in the book while at the same time, barely mentioning others. This book is good to build upon a basic knowledge and library of similar books on the survival subject. However, it would not be good book to get as a beginner. All in all, a good book to be purchased later in your reading cycle on the subject.
customer_reviews.author: KRTL

customer_reviews.title: Nephew loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a nephew at Christmas. He's not a 'prepper type,' but he liked it so much that he started reading it and didn't want to put it down!
customer_reviews.author: Noah J. Lehr

customer_reviews.title: Practical resource.
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking to prepare for the end of the world, off grid living or just need helpful tips to reserve the natural resources of the earth. This is the book for you! All you need to know about bug out bags, extreme life saving situations and even combative zone warfare. Bring on the world, this book has you covered.
customer_reviews.author: CoExistance

customer_reviews.title: Not what it seems to be!
customer_reviews.text: This books contains zero actual instruction. It has lots of lists of what to do but not how to do it. It also tells you about other books you can find the information in, but has no information. This is the worst survival book I've ever laid eyes on. It is a total waist of money.
customer_reviews.author: Houston

customer_reviews.title: One of the best book purchases I have made
customer_reviews.text: One of the best book purchases I have made. very interesting to read and lots of good information. Helps a lot when deciding on products.Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't stop reading it once I started. Great Book!
customer_reviews.text: This book was incredible. I couldn't stop reading it once I started it. I like how the author puts in real life scenarios at the beginning of each chapter. It really gives you a feeling of actually living in an disaster ridden reality. I would recommend this to anybody who wants to be prepared for an upcoming disaster.
customer_reviews.author: Birdmonkey

customer_reviews.title: worthy read
customer_reviews.text: Good overall think piece. Wide discussion of topics. Somewhat biased in places but tries to minimize that.
customer_reviews.author: LS

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s an okay book , there are Better ones out there for sure ! But this is a good book to have around just in case
customer_reviews.author: BIGDOGBRANDO

customer_reviews.title: This is the kind of stuff you need to know before you absolutely need to know
customer_reviews.text: Is the kind of stuff you need to know before you absolutely need to know
customer_reviews.author: plan ahead

customer_reviews.title: but the book is a good guide to help identify the issues particular to your ...
customer_reviews.text: not as in depth as I'd imagined, more of a detailed check list; everyone's situation is different, so if you want details on how to do something specific, you'll have to research it on the Web, but the book is a good guide to help identify the issues particular to your situation.
customer_reviews.author: vvurdsmyth

customer_reviews.title: Practicle Knowledge
customer_reviews.text: I found this book to be what I was looking for. I've been a six month prepper for years. The author , in clear want to read language reinforced much of my knowledge and gave me many more tips on easier methods to address a longer occurring disaster period. God forbid, it could be the best reference books you'll own. RI Game Warden.
customer_reviews.author: Dean Lees

customer_reviews.title: First Impressions
customer_reviews.text: I received the book today. It looks interesting and I look forward to reading it especially since our wonderful USA is in meltdown mode. I may need some of this advice sooner rather than later.
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: Great book for gettin your toes wet for the first ...
customer_reviews.text: Great book for gettin your toes wet for the first time in the survivalist world. Great guide/check list on what supplies you should start stocking up on now before hand. Great info on bartering items and community living. Some survivalists info gets repeated but that's just the nature of it! Good read and will be glad to have a copy around when SHTF
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for any survivalists
customer_reviews.text: Great book. I've been wanting to learn more about living off grid and after getting through most of it I find it very informative. The author also mentions other informative books as well. Great buy and very well priced.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Must Read
customer_reviews.text: Everyone should read this book and have a copy in their home
customer_reviews.author: kaylee

customer_reviews.title: I took a lot of notes while reading this book.  Loved it!
customer_reviews.text: This was the third book of Jim Cobb's that I have read. I love his books. There is a lot of common sense written into his books, and they are easy to understand and read. There were many ideas in this book that I had already put into practice. But, there were also a lot of things that I hadn't thought about. I took lots of notes while I read this book because I didn't want to forget any of Jim's ideas that I hadn't already thought of myself.
customer_reviews.author: CJA

customer_reviews.title: I purchased multiple copies of this book and distributed as ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased multiple copies of this book and distributed as gifts. The families receiving them very much appreciated the items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book
customer_reviews.text: Great content in every page. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Williams

customer_reviews.title: Simple.
customer_reviews.text: Great book for a beginner. I didn’t learn anything new but I gave it to my assistant at work who has not yet started prepping and didn’t know where to begin.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Livingston

customer_reviews.title: Thanks Jim
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed the book and liked the lists provided as well as the other books that are recommended for further research.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I expected a more detailed and thorough guide. Too superficial, not enough content.
customer_reviews.author: Earlmvc

customer_reviews.title: Decent book
customer_reviews.text: Ok book, more like an interesting read than a helpful book
customer_reviews.author: Bryon.ratcliff

customer_reviews.title: If you can only get one prepping book l. Get this one!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have gotten about three or four chapters in and it’s stocked full of great info that is already coming in handy. Preparing for the worst as we hope for the best
customer_reviews.author: Anneka mundorff

customer_reviews.title: GREAT READ! VERY HELPFUL INFORMATION!
customer_reviews.text: This book is a very easy read with very helpful information! I am happy with my purchase :) Thank You!
customer_reviews.author: bizbossgirl

customer_reviews.title: Good introduction to prepping
customer_reviews.text: Contents are basic, but well written. An introduction to basic survival needs without an in-depth analysis of each topic.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Nicosia

customer_reviews.title: Prepping 101 to be sure
customer_reviews.text: If you're starting,read it.If you're already involved you'll probably not find much you don't already know, but I enjoyed reading( and a lot of skimming) through it. It's the basics in a very palatable format.
customer_reviews.author: bornin69

customer_reviews.title: Good read , I read it twice
customer_reviews.text: Good information and great book that covers most things necessary to dig your place in the world by much simpler means
customer_reviews.author: Poe Phat

customer_reviews.title: If prepping is about buying a few obvious items then this book does that but nothing more
customer_reviews.text: This book was very disappointing. I wish I could return it. I was looking for a book that could help me be self reliant and survive. This book doesn’t really do that.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Beth Masimore

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Great book and well written for those of us who are beginning to think about survival prepping. This should be your first purchase if you're like me and unsure of how to proceed with the prep!
customer_reviews.author: Thegal

customer_reviews.title: Great book for Preppers.
customer_reviews.text: Enjoyed reading the book and looking forward to implementing some of the ideas.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Kel

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy it
customer_reviews.text: From what was written on sale information i do believe the book a real joke. Would not buy it again.! Could not say it was worth what i paid fir it very disappointing
customer_reviews.author: michael k

customer_reviews.title: Worthy investment
customer_reviews.text: So glad that I disregarded a negative review!!! A real asset, in my opinion, to any prepper library. I currently engage in limited bartering so that chapter, for me, had my undivided attention. After reading it, I was thinking, "duh! That makes perfect sense!"
customer_reviews.author: Angela M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great content
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy the check list in the back of the book. I also really enjoy the fake journal entries at the beginning of each chapter. They really help a person realize what kind of problems people have to face after an emp occurs.
customer_reviews.author: Tigers#77

customer_reviews.title: Survival skills
customer_reviews.text: All about surviving in disaster it’s times. Good information we don’t normally think about. Not as much food survival teaching as I expected but ordered a second book just for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best information ever
customer_reviews.text: This book contains the best practical information, It is so detailed. Follow these recommendations and you'll be prepared For whatever comes down
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift for my boyfriend and he loves it. We are doomsday preppers, but want to be prepared if any sort of disaster strikes. Most books out there state the obvious, but this one goes a little more in depth in the "whats and hows" of being prepared.
customer_reviews.author: Julesaa

customer_reviews.title: Good, general, world-ending prediction and preperation guide
customer_reviews.text: A good read and nicely written. Friendly, honest, and to the point. If wanting to prepare to a end-of-the-world changing event this does nicely. It almost reads more science-fictiony so I probably enjoyed it more for that entertainment value.
customer_reviews.author: Todd Partridge

customer_reviews.title: good information repeated on other places
customer_reviews.text: good information repeated on other places,,,but some new ideas too,,,,if you are just starting being interested in survival,,,this is a good place to start,,,not complete for all you need to know,,,but a good book,,,recommended
customer_reviews.author: bill45colt

customer_reviews.title: Good info
customer_reviews.text: Easy to read and follow. Great resource to gift to your local library this holiday season.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: This guy is the best for down to earth advice, strategies, and ideas. No macho BS, just "get real" suggestions. He's got lot's of other books on various aspects of the same topic. If your just beginning or been at it awhile you get a lot out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie R.

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: My boyfriend really learned a lot reading this book. Worse case scenario, we'll be ready.
customer_reviews.author: Tess Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Good book to read
customer_reviews.text: Book was very informative. liked it very much and it is written in a easy to understand fashion
customer_reviews.author: Modesto Talavera

customer_reviews.title: Best of class!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great , no nonsense kinda book. Well thought out, interesting enough to actually read. A must for preppers of any level, or those who are considering prepping
customer_reviews.author: Steve Reynolds

customer_reviews.title: Excellent guide
customer_reviews.text: This book is an excellent guide for survivalist learning. Very thorough with examples. I highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good Book
customer_reviews.text: Overall good information, laid out well, and reads well. It is always good to have books around, for when the power isn't.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome, Mr
customer_reviews.text: Awesome, Mr. Cobb does it again. This author is the real deal who takes prepping very seriously. He does all the research and puts in words anyone could understand.
customer_reviews.author: Don P.

customer_reviews.title: A way to live
customer_reviews.text: This book is a very good reference, not only for the prepper but for the conciencious inhabitant of this planet. There are not instant recipes, but leads into a way of frugal life.
customer_reviews.author: J. Parks

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good information in this book. I haven't read all of it but it's a good book.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great book
customer_reviews.text: Filled with a lot of great information. I highly recommend for anyone who wants to be prepared. I like the fact there is also ongoing information.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Norton Azar

customer_reviews.title: Good read! I appreciated the moments of humor on ...
customer_reviews.text: Good read! I appreciated the moments of humor on what otherwise could have been a very stark book. Lots of information and thought provoking moments. I would recommend it to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Shelby Lohr

customer_reviews.title: but pretty good as a supplemental book along with others that ...
customer_reviews.text: Not as informative as I was expecting, but pretty good as a supplemental book along with others that have more specification on things to do and how to build etc.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Sieber

customer_reviews.title: It's got both , Depth and Breadth
customer_reviews.text: Mr. Cobb covers many topics in this book, some you would never think of. He goes into enough detail to give practical solutions, and to pique your curiosity to find out more. It is a great overall book for long-term survival.
customer_reviews.author: JimmJames

customer_reviews.title: The book has a lot of good information I should've done a little more reading before ...
customer_reviews.text: The book has a lot of good information I should've done a little more reading before buying and bought a more detailed book. Other than that the book is fine
customer_reviews.author: Richard M

customer_reviews.title: Although there are a few good points, this book is for a beginner with ...
customer_reviews.text: Although there are a few good points, this book is for a beginner with absolutely no survival knowledge. It presents several points that should be considered, but doesn't really explain how to achieve ones objective. I do admit that my opinion may be a bit biased because I have long believed in being prepared. In the 80's the called me paranoid; in the 90's a survivalist, and now they call me a prepper. I prefer survivalist.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Found Prepper's Long Term Survival Giude quite useful
customer_reviews.text: The guide gives an excellent overview of how to successfully survive in the long term, when the dust has settled. We have been preparing for years yet still found both new ideas and reinforcement that what we are doing and can do are on track. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Jones

customer_reviews.title: Gift for my daughter
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a Christmas gift for my daughter. I will need to ask her for an opinion.....don't know yet.
customer_reviews.author: jmt

product_meta.title: Prepper's Long-Term Survival Guide: Food, Shelter, Security, Off-the-Grid Power and More Life-Saving Strategies for Self-Sufficient Living
